column15:
Thanks for leaving a review Finn - we appreciate your feedback.

In the meantime you can turn off the Biometric security option when you're next in the Monzo app.

• Tap the Home icon in the menu bar
• Tap your profile picture in the top left of the screen
• Tap the settings cog icon in the top right of the screen
• Tap Privacy & Security

I constantly receive requests for me to confirm my account details and a photo of my passport to be issued via an unsecured email network. Be very very careful.

column10: Why do I need to approve my payments? Can't really count how many times I had to go to Monzo app to approve payment which then refreshed the website where I was trying to buy something making me lose all the progress. It's really frustrating.
column15: Sorry this so so frustrating, Becca 😔 At the moment, it's up to a merchant whether or not they enrol in Mastercard's 3DSecure process, and many do to reduce fraud. From March 2022 it's also going to be a requirement from our regulators that more payments are approved, and you can read more about that on the FCA website here: https://bit.ly/3rYGczx

column10: Having used and relied on this for months now there's one question that's been on my mind since the start: why is your card PIN number also your password for the app? Needles to say this is a security flaw, you're shopping around and should your PIN get compromised then you'll also have your whole account compromised, not just the card. Why can't there be separate login credentials for the app? Why isn't there also an option to change your PIN through the app itself at least?
column15: Hey there 👋 Thanks so much for raising your concerns with us. We've passed this feedback on to our product team to consider. Just to note - we send a magic link to the email address linked to your account before a login on a new device is possible. As long as your email is secure, only you'll have access. We hope that makes sense! 🙏

'Fixed term saving pots' have the ability to lock money away for 3, 6 or 12 months 🔐 Once you've put money in a fixed term pot, you can't withdraw from it until the term ends. Take a look at the 'Earn interest on your money' section in the app to find a suitable savings pot.

column15:
Hey Stephen 👋 Thanks so much for your feedback. You can use your fingerprint to log in to your app.

To turn it on, just follow these steps:
- Tap on the Home tab
- Tap on the cog wheel in the top right
- Tap "Privacy & Security"
- Toggle "Use Fingerprint to unlock app" and you'll be good to go.

column15:
Hey Jamil 👋

Sorry for the confusion! It's not possible to unsubscribe from these messages as they aren't technically marketing. Whilst we include some product information in them, there are other ways to keep your fee-free allowances which don't involve giving us any money 😊 You can find out more info here: https://bit.ly/2L406rD

I just migrated from Nigeria. In Nigeria, all banks send transactional alerts (money in, money out) via SMS & all banks verify any bank account you're paying to, if you're paying online or in-app. Imagine my utmost surprise that these 2 features were NOT common features in UK banks. So, when I discovered Monzo and discovered that Monzo had that first feature I wanted (transactional alerts), I was sold! Monzo all the way! Most UK banks now have this account verification thing, so, it's all good!

column15: Hi Mart, we're introducing a 3% fee on withdrawals over £250 every 30 days to help us with costs. A minority of our customers rely on us the least, but cost us the most. We think it's fair to ask them to cover those costs when they rely on another bank rather than us. You can read more here: https://monzo.com/blog/withdrawal-and-card-delivery-fees

I love Monzo. I'm a visual person & while other banks didn't track spending in real time, Monzo has really helped me with my spending habits. I'm able to creat as many saving pots & plan my money better. For once I feel that I'm in control of my money. I've used Monzo overseas & it's amazing. They do the best currency exchange rates & you don't need to faff around with banks exchange rates or panic when you run out of money during your holiday. I will 100% recommend Monzo to anyone & everyone.

I like Monzo, for the most part it just works. But the app features that enticed me to switch to full Monzo have mostly been removed or hidden away to the point they're useless. The really useful timeline where you could easily see your balance over time is gone. Payee details are being moved so now they're harder to find. They have attempted a subscription service twice and after failing the first time they've relaunched a subscription that somehow offers even less than before. Not to mention a lot of the 'paid for' features are available free with other banks, such as Starling. Monzo continue to make bad decisions and couple that with their knack to haemorrhage money at an alarming rate means I am leaving to a better bank where I will worry less about the security of my finances.

I've been with Monzo now for 18 months and I wish I'd done it sooner. I can see at a glance how much I've spent that day, what payments/bills are coming up, if they're higher or lower than the last payment, how much money I've got left and much more. There's also an annual summary page. You can categorise your money into sections like General, Shopping, Groceries, Family, Bills, Eating Out and several more. You can open savings pots and flexibly invest your money with Monzo too.

column10: Monzo is amazing, no two ways about it. It's a next generation bank, fully authorised, recognised and with UK bank guarantees. It is simple to set up and use, and the account and card are accepted everywhere that Mastercard is. The pots (savings), budgets, and types of expenditure can really transform the way you look at your spending and saving habits. The rounding up feature (up to the nearest pound, added to your savings) is fantastic too. Transactions are instant unlike traditional banks.

Amazing, recommend this to anyone. A great way to keep an eye on your day to day spending, if you go abroad it's a must. I don't know how it compares with other similar cards? But I find this one great, easy to use and super useful.

The best banking app I've ever used. Easy to budget, transfer money, and instant notifications when money comes out your account or you're about to go into your overdraft. I really like the top-up saving function, and it's easy to separate out money with pots too.

column10: Excellent customer service once again from Monzo...Booked a flight with the now liquidated FlyBe company for £175 and though all was lost. Contacted the Monzo team via chat on the app not expecting any claim, they were instantly positive and asked a few questions then told me to wait up to 3 months... 2 months later and a full refund appears in my account! I probably wouldn't have even got through security on the phone to my old bank in the time it took to raise the claim - so impressed. 😊😊😊

The app works quite well but I have serious security concerns. If challenged for a PIN (only happened once for me) and you fail on 3 attempts, account is blocked and you have to go through difficult hoops to recover i.e. photo of passport or similar ID, video and still selfies which can be difficult especially if anything is wrong with your mobile, perhaps causing the issue in the fist place.. However, if you get through all that and recover, the app then lets you in every time with no challenge at all - very insecure imho. Finger print or PIN should be the standard for access. Having just your mobile as the only means of access to your account is risky with no backup means of access via a regular web browser on any other device.

You've also relegated the "spending breakdown" to a sub menu. Budgeting is probably the main reason anyone chooses you over a competitor,l so this doesn't seem to make sense?
Stable app, & better than revolut that forces users to upgrade there android OS.
Great
Ok
I didn't like the new layout or new look is so ruuuubbish just time wasting rubbbbbbbish. Please set it back the old layout or at at least give the user option to chose. Regards,

5stars

Loved its simplicity. Benchmark of a consumer digital bank.
After update to 9.0 Pie on Razer phone app just crashing .Thx for taking all my savings -,-

I was a massive fan of Monzo up until this latest update. For me, the interface has become a little frustrating as someone who uses pots a lot of the time. Using them is now an extra click for every action which is frustrating and having seemingly infinite options on where to swipe to see other views is a bit excessive for me. Until this point, I was battling it out with my partner on whether Monzo or Starling was better and, for the first time, I'm actually tempted to give Starling a go.
Really good bank

I absolutely love Monzo, but am really disappointed by the new design. It's hard to navigate, has lost the visual management of my money, and pots/swapping between accounts is confusing too. Everyone I know who has the new design also hates it!! Please give us back the beautiful app!
nice

Dreadful illogical updates. Have been using this a few days now and still can't understand the layout. The previous version was clear and easy to navigate, I'm not sure whether this new version was sufficiently tested with customers? Navigation is really awkward. I can't find features I used to use, it's all over the place! It's a real shame as I thought Monzo was industry leading mainly because it was easy to use.

This bank and app used to be the best, but since the recent update everything went bananas. I am not feeling the user interface at all. The previous versions in August were good. Please kindly fix this issue immediately. Thank you very much indeed for your cooperation.
I'm not a luddite, but the new look/update is awful
So good banks could learn from this
I loved this banking app when I first got it but since it's updated and changed I actually don't like it anymore.
Great app, tho may I add a suggestion: would like to add money in pots by specific amounts instead of in £5 stages

Monzo's new look is entirely based on pushing their users towards 'doing more with Monzo', e.g. setting up savings so Monzo can earn fees/gain liquidity, or transferring money so Monzo can spread to new users through exposure. Pretty weak from them. This takes away from their core offering as the spending breakdown is no longer one of their main tabs. Disappointing - would no longer recommend.
Best bank ever
Best feature now removed from App. Can't see any reason for that. I feel cheated.

New look is all so pale and lacks contrast; the bot makes it impossible to give feedback now; and the help community is a mess. Settings are hidden and layered. I used to love the app, now everything is frustrating. Monzo need to stop and think before introducing changes without talking to customers more, and especially those outside London please.
I installed this and tried to open account but on selfie video option is not working for proof of identity.i followed all the rules.very upset fix a new version apps or update it
Like Monzo but please revert to old layout. New one is confusing and not user friendly.
Amazing bank really useful app

OH MY GOD! The new app designer, IT'S A DISASTER! Why on earth would you change such a good structure. This is a downgrade not an update. Really, disappointed, the app is complicated, not easily navigated and there things missing. To the team working on the app design 👎👎👎
Its ok

Worried Investor here - I love Monzo, but what is going on with this new update, they have removed the functionality to see your rolling ballance as you scroll through your transactions over time... Seriously! How could they do this, why remove such useful things, even the pay graph with a clear prediction of future spending is gone. Listen to the considerable number of users who feel the same as me and have posted reviews, why remove the functionality to see you balance on a specific date.
blocked my account with the money if notice and for no reason!!
New app is bright white - No Dark mode. Don't use this bank as the response online is just to merge suggestions into archived threads. Chat wait over 5 hours if you have an issue.
I can't send money because of the screen overlay issue. I have no problems with this before the update. What should I do?
column15: Hi there, we're sorry to hear you're having trouble with the app at the moment. We'd love to hear more about this screen overlay issue so please drop us a message through the in-app chat if you haven't already. Thanks!

column10: Was a really nice app and bank to use. Recently notifications stopped working but uninstalling and reinstalling eventually sorted it but had a recent update and its rubbish. Horrible layout. Previous was much nicer to use. Was main thing I liked about it. Dont think I can be bothered with it much longer due to it, just need to locate a joint account elsewhere. Shame
Poor support
Really good, easy to use app. Very happy to find Monzo Bank! Download and use it. You won't be disappointed!
Very good . i love it.
Nice

Very surprised with options and abilities provided by Monzo, so much easier to track your finances. I've been loyal to Halifax for at least 10 years, and to be honest there was no positive changes done during all my experience with them and no improvements in tech way How comes that such a new online bank gives you so many perks compared to high street bank. Still keeping my Halifax account but it's on 0 transactions for the past 4 months because of its basics service, will shut it down soon

At 1st I was a little lost using the app and couldn't remember what o needed to press to get to statements or set up standing orders. I'm still trying to figure out the whole budget system and income and expenditure part however I really to love the app and the bank. Getting paid early as well is a bonus. I've given 5 stars even though I'm still a bit lost but that's just how good it is
Just love the simplicity of this card so easy to keep track of your spending and you can use it anywhere
Great

Best app

STILL can't filter transactions by date after how long? Monzo announced LONG TIME AGO that Android and Apple apps would be up-to-date with one another but this isn't the case. How are we suppose to trust you?
The new look in 3.0 makes the usage so much clearer, particularly between accessing multiple accounts. Easy to use once you take time to work it out.
Excellent bank wouldn't be without it

Recently signed up to monzo. Overall very impressed with what it is bringing and the unique features over traditional banks. Though I don't like the new design which was automatically set to use after sign up but I then found the old layout toggle in labs section. The old layout is so much easier and cleaner. Why the change!? If it ain't broke don't fix it. I would rather monzo implement meaningful features than redesign something that didn't need to change. Like Samsung pay support!

New design is absolutely not userfriendly, and during these few days I can not find how to put a pin for my application.Please, go back to previous version as it is all we need, easy and useful no need to put everything on the same page.
Goodbye highest bank, hello monzo!
New update is so sad :( not as user friendly and visually appealing.
Great banking
Easy to use app and a great bank ran by great people as it seems.

The best app i have ever used! I can say that Monzo is my new bank and will be looking to rid myself of legacy banking such as natwest. Monzo is very easy to use and very in depth and shows you exactly what you owe/when and provides many soloutions to help you manage your money better. This is also very secure and feel more confident using monzo over any other bank now! My family recommended me using monzo and over the last year this has replaced spending/saving as i know it!!!!! :D
Miles better than Starling

Starting to behave like a normal bank. New features are few and far between and delivery on them is poor. Received an email about the new experience a week ago bragging about how good and future facing it was. I'm still on the old experience one week later. Guess that this is a good example of how just because it's a startup it doesn't mean it's agile, or that they deliver more frequently or better than the old geriatric banks.
I am less than impressed, cannot gain access to my account and on the verge of closing the account as access via app is currently useless! Had to give 1 star but wanted to give 0!
Absolutely love Monzo!

I prefer the previous UI it was easy to do things.the new one is as bad as Tsb

Best online banking app I have ever used! A lot better than the average high street bank! Very useful tools to help you budget your money! The other banks that have both branches and also have an online banking app are ok, but this one is by far the best that I have ever used so far!
Just wonderful
New interface is awful and no option to revert to an older apk. Clearly not ready to replace the old UI, support not helpful. It wasnt brpken and they fixed it into a complete mess.
Not a fan of the new look... Style over function.
Its good bank
Why do I need to right 500 words in a review when It can be summed up in one simple word - perfect.

I don't understand why companies have to purposefully change clean looking apps with a nice intuitive design and turn them into messy bloated behemoths. One of Monzo's great charms was it's ease of use. I get the financial desire to always monetise the customer base more, but if you make us dislike our UX because your UI forces us to keep acting in ways we don't like, then you'll ultimately get low revenues per user, not higher. Be like Steve Jobs. Give us a CLEAN design. Stop feature creep!
Dobre
very good

The bank itself is great, I love having a separate pot for savings with rounded up spends. I liked seeing the circle of my budget for the month as it stopped me from spending if it was in the minus but unfortunately that has changed into a straight line and I don't think it has the same effect. The app is harder to use now and just don't know why they changed it so much. It doesn't have the same overall effect it had before.
Best online banking

Best bank ever, I am amazed by this bank, every single thing I want in a bank is finally here! You guys are doing so amazing and you don't give up to keep listening to people with what they want to see in the future, thank you so much for making my life 100% more easier!
'Unfortunately we cannot offer you a Monzo account at the moment'? What's the point of this app existing if they won't let people use it?!

Not a fan of this new update. I like the idea of a lot of the features but if just doesn't feel intuitive or easy to use. Knowing you guys at Monzo I'm sure you will continue to work on it, but please do soon as I'm really not enjoying it and it's giving me mad stress when I have to quickly transfer money or check an account.
Good stuff

I love the bank, but the new app update (optional one) is disappointing. So many useful features like the spent graph (top of home page) and end of the day ballance is gone, now I can only see how much I spent every day, not how much was my balance by EOD. I noticed it is slow as well which might get better in final version, I transferred some money, the app was showing the money received but it took around 5minute to update my balance. Please bring cool features specially spent graph back!
Very poor app they said I was aloud a overdraft even know my credit history is very good but nothing has changed
Great

However this new app update got rid of the pulsegraph which was super useful for reviewing your balance history. Now it's really hard to see that information. Could you include the balance history in the breakdown of transactions?
Top class
Cant find out how to passcode my account... when I tap on the app everything comes straight up and is accessible to anyone who uses my phone.

Literally went down from 5 stars to 2 for me. I used to love this app. It was so easy to use, to find your way around and see everything you need straight away. Now it is a search game to find everything I want to. The design is fine I guess, but it is nothing special or standing out anymore as it was before. I got Monzo because it was easier to use than all the conventional banking apps. Please stop trying to be conventional when you are great at standing out.
love this app. only using it as my spending money bank at the minute

2019-09S-28th - Recent update seems to have removed the daily balance. Without it, it's so much harder to reconcile my account. 2019-09S-14th - Not what I expected, it's a lot more! Tried this for the Coin Jar element but have found it a great budgeting tool. Two things I'd like to see: 1. A timeout on the fingerprint authorisation. 2. Ability to add or modify categories. Keep up the good work.

Great for budgeting, lots of perks like pots, early pay day graphs etc. Would recommend them 100%. I am having problems since this monday with my payments, i was at the market trying to buy food and you guys blocked alll my payments!!! This is not the first time.... and i already send you guys a direct on the app and nobody answers me at all!! I do not recomend monzo

Only plus is that a lot of people have it so it's easy to transfer money to people.

The new update it absolutely dreadful..."if it's not broken don't fix it". It's now not as intuative to navigate, now employs a confusing and busy GUI and is very buggy, crashes frequently. Because Monzo is an app only bank, the app really matters doesn't it? The app is now dreadful, so think I'll have to look around for a better option. Such a shame...why mess with a winning formula so early on in this companies development?

An excellent company to disrupt the corporate banking system :)

Very easy to navigate with a beautiful design. I love the fact that you get notified immediately shortly after a transaction. It provides specifics of where the transaction took place using google maps, the name of the facility/service/person and you can even add a picture of the receipt. The contact service is also brilliant, you can speak with someone over the phone, email or webchat. I am very impressed as I had no expectations of this bank. I highly recommend it!

App works really well. Notifies you of transactions quickly, allows detailed budgeting. A very friendly interface that's fun to use. I chose not to use the overdraft facility but it's easy to set up if needed and presumably if you have no major credit problems. All in all, great!

Your account and pots are now in a swipeable area at the top of the app. I'm surprised a UX designer approved this as most of the mobile retail space is whitespace and you can hardly see any more detail without interacting. 2/3 transactions at most on your account and just the amount you have in a pot and how often it's replenished. Also the "wheel" has now gone which I found useful seeing outright as you had a sense of your budget for the rest of the month. Took me ages to make a new pot too.
gr8 app

Few improvements needed, but a great app/bank. The bill split is a great feature which should be added to all online banking. Its a small feature but the logos used on the transactions page make it very easy to find payments, rather than looking though obscure references. The budgeting dates should be fully customizable (e.g. every monday, fortnightly etc) rather than just monthly or 4weekly. Sometimes the roundups dont work but I havent seen a pattern so probably just a glitch.

When taking money from pots the app takes ages to reflict this in your balance. Monzo should also have the option to transfer money between pots and not have to withdraw and then deposit into your chosen pot.

Main reason why I switched to Monzo and was even deluded to convince my partner to do it was 3 things: shared tabs, splitting bills and control over monthly spending. It's impossible to have all of those done correctly. Simple example. I bought tickets for a flight. That was a one time off payment so I excluded it from my monthly summary. Great, it didn't count to summary. I bought those tickets for my partner as well so I've split this bill. She paid me back but I CANNOT exclude this from monthly spending summary so it adds up and actually show as an income. I've been trying to talk about it with customer service but all I got was first AI bot, then a series of sessions: sorry for waiting so long, whats your problem? this and this... I cannot help you but I'll get you someone who could help, a day later: sorry for waiting so long, what's your problem.....  Shared tab has the same flaw. Summary takes under consideration whole of your payment even after shared tab is settled. There is a thread about it in Monzo Community but it looks like nobody cares. Now imagine my partner when I tell her that I want to switch to another bank.... thank you guys!
